column2: Start an overthrow revolt against [Root.GetTitledFirstName] led by the Court Faction, as if they had voted to do so.
Start an overthrow revolt against [Root.GetTitledFirstName] led by the Prosperity Faction, as if they had voted to do so.
Start an overthrow revolt against [Root.GetTitledFirstName] led by the Glory Faction, as if they had voted to do so.
Start an overthrow revolt against [Root.GetTitledFirstName] led by the Tradition Faction, as if they had voted to do so.
Dump [Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s civil war state tracking information to game.log.

You may incite a normal faction overthrow revolt, as if the faction had decided to do so, wherein dynamic call-to-arms will work as always. Alternatively, you may bypass the usual call-to-arms AI code so that all vassals not already at war will join. Either way, the initiating faction will revolt regardless of war status.
This faction is not already part of a revolt.\n
